author: sstreet
title: Lassana Diarra: Chelsea and Arsenal‚Äôs former midfield star sensationally released by Marseille after going on strike to secure China move
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LASSANA DIARRA has left Marseille by mutual consent after going on strike to secure a move to China. 
The French midfielder has been looking for a higher salary to help pay off a ¬£6.8m debt to Lokomotiv Moscow for breach of contract. üî¥ OFFICIAL | OM announce the contract termination and departure of Lassana Diarra pic.twitter.com/jj4KHUL9NT 
‚Äî Olympique Marseille (@OM_English) February 14, 2017 Getty Images 4 Lassana Diarra has been released by Marseille 
Chinese club Shandong Luneng are believed to be offering a lucrative deal and Diarra had refused to play for Marseille in order to force through the move. 
Today the club announced the midfielder‚Äôs departure and refused even to thank him for his spell in the South of France. 
A very brief statement on the Marseille website read: ‚ÄúOlympique de Marseille and Lassana Diarra have terminated his contract by mutual consent, effective today. 
‚ÄúHaving arrived without a transfer fee in the 2015-16 season, Lassana Diarra spent a season and a half at Olympique Marseille.‚Äù Getty Images The Frenchman went on strike to secure a move to China Getty Images He is now expectedc to move to Shandong Luneng and play alongside the likes of Graziano Pelle Getty Images 4 Diarra is desperate for money as he owes former club Lokomotiv Moscow ¬£6.8m in compensation 
Diarra left Lokomotiv Moscow without their consent in 2014 and the Court of Arbitration for Sport last year ordered him to pay the hefty compensation fee. 
He was linked with Valencia and Man United last transfer window but both moves failed to materialise. Dimitri Payet scores his first goal since returning to Marseille, albeit with a huge deflection 
But the Chinese transfer window stays open until February 26 and the Frenchman was clearly desperate to close the deal. 
Former Fulham boss Felix Magath is believed to be in advanced talks with Diarra, and with Marseille agreeing to release the player, the move is now expected to go ahead.
